meanings.sent1: She kept overbleaching her hair, causing it to become brittle and damaged.
meanings.sent2: I warned her not to overbleach her clothes, as it may ruin the fabric.
meanings.sent3: The laundry mishap resulted from her overbleaching spree.
meanings.sent4: Her constant overbleaching of the towels turned them into ghostly white shadows of their former selves.
meanings.sent5: The sun overbleaching the curtains made them almost transparent.

meanings.definition: The act of bleaching too much.
meanings.sent1: Overbleaching can lead to discoloration and weakening of the fibers.
meanings.sent2: The overbleaching of the walls left them looking unnaturally bright.
meanings.sent3: The overbleaching incident in the salon caused quite a commotion.
meanings.sent4: The overbleaching of the paper made it fragile and prone to tearing.
meanings.sent5: The overbleaching of the teeth resulted in a stark, unnatural whiteness.

meanings.sent1: The overbleaching of the wood stripped it of its natural color.
meanings.sent2: Overbleaching can sometimes be more harmful than beneficial.
meanings.sent3: The overbleaching of the grass made it look like a field of snow.
meanings.sent4: The overbleaching of the hair left it looking dull and lifeless.
meanings.sent5: The overbleaching of the skin caused irritation and redness.
